task_summary: Detect and grasp the white plate, then move and place it onto the red plate, releasing gently and retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A 6-DOF xArm with a parallel-jaw gripper must pick up a white plate visible on the mat and place it onto a red plate located to the left. The sequence includes perception of both plates, a precise approach and rim pinch grasp of the white plate, transport toward the red plate, gentle placement with surface contact detection, release, and retreat. Frames show approach, tilt/secure grasp of the white plate, and a subsequent move toward the red plate area.
preconditions: Robot is homed and within workspace limits
White plate and red plate are on the mat and within view
Gripper operational and empty at start
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and detect white plate; scan if needed.
Move above and align; compute grasp; perform pick.
Detect red plate; move above it.
Lower until contact with surface; open gripper to release.
success_criteria: White plate securely grasped (no slip during transport)
White plate placed centered on the red plate with contact established
Robot retreats to a safe height without collisions
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure → scan pattern and retry detection
Grasp slip → re-align and recompute grasp
Contact not detected → lower again within max depth, else abort
Placement misalignment → re-detect red plate and re-attempt
task_long_description.termination: Task ends after successful release on the red plate and safe retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: Clear contact with the white plate rim; plate visibly tilted and engaged by the gripper.
frame_3.predicts_next: Transport toward the red plate is expected after confirming a secure grasp.

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Open gripper to widest allowed width before grasp/release.
Detect the white plate; quick perception.
Fallback scan if initial detection fails.
Align gripper orientation with plate rim.
Confirm the white plate is held.
Move above red plate for placement.
Back off to a safe height.

failure_modes: White plate not detected due to glare/occlusion
Pinch grasp slips on smooth rim
Red plate detection confused by background
Contact not detected within max depth during placement
recovery_strategy: Re-align and recompute grasp pose then reattempt pick
Abort if contact not found after safe depth
assumptions: Frames show the white plate being tilted/engaged around frame_3, consistent with a rim pinch.
Red plate is the large red disc at lower-left; after placement the white plate may be occluded or blend with lighting.
Exact placement pose key not provided; we use contact-based placement (LowerUntilContact + release).

expected_success_criteria: Release performed after contact on red plate surface
No collisions during transfer and retreat
